ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Of course, if the person is serious about doing macroeconomics. The technique is very useful, above and beyond the course. It's the first time in life that I witnessed how much faster fortran is compared to Matlab.
excellent course if interested in Macro and Inequality, not so interesting for Macro students interested in other sub-areas
Numerical recipes to solve demanding computation in macroeconomic models.
Very focused on numerical methods. Very good and very useful class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I definitely learned a lot from this course beyond the computational methods. I do believe that heterogeneous models will be the future of economics, especially macroeconomics.
Very relevant numerical methods were taught, which will be useful for future research. Could focus a bit more on estimation (as discussed in last class).
